A companion to the British and Irish novel 1945-2000
Blackwell companions to literature and culture

subject.$: The prime of Miss Jean Brodie

description.$: Indhold: Contexts for the British and Irish novel, 1945-2000 ; Reading individual texts and authors (Samuel Beckett's Watt / S.E. Gontarski and Chris Ackerley. Erika Gottlieb: George Orwell's dystopias : Animal farm and Nineteen Eighty-Four. Bernard Schweizer: Evelyn Waugh's Brideshead revisited and other late novels. Patrick A. McCarthy: Modernism's swansong : Malcolm Lowrys's Under the volcano. Cedric Watts: The heart of the matter and the later novels of Graham Greene. Kevin McCarron: William Golding's Lord of the flies and other early novels. Merritt Moseley: Amis, father and son. Margaret Moan Rowe: Dame Iris Murdoch. Kenneth Womack: The campus novel in context. Julius Rowan Raper: Lawrence Durrell's Alexandria quartet. Peter J. Schakel: The Oxford fantasists : C.S. Lewis and J.R.R. Tolkien. Bryan Cheyette: Muriel Spark's The prime of Miss Jean Brodie. Judith Kegan Gardiner: Doris Lessing's The golden notebook. John J. Su: Jean Rhys's Wide Sargasso sea. James Acheson: John Fowles's The French leutenant's woman. Nicola Pitchford: Angela Carter. Margaret Moan Rowe: Margaret Drabble. Timothy Weiss: V.S. Naipaul. Nico Israel: Salman Rushdie. Donna Potts: The Irish novel after Joyce. Cheryl Alexander Malcolm: Anita Brookner. Merritt Moseley: Julian Barnes's Flaubert's parrot. Cynthia F. Wong: Kazuo Ishiguro's The remains of the day. Rebecca L. Walkowitz: Ian McEwan. Donald P. Kaczvinsky: Graham Swift. David Goldie: The Scottish new wave. Lynn Wells: A.S. Byatt's Possession : a romance. Anne Whitehead: Pat Barker's Regeneration trilogy)

title.$: Understanding Animal farm : a student casebook to issues, sources, and historical documents
The Greenwood Press "Literature in context" series

abstract.$: Litterær analyse samt kildetekster,der relaterer til George Orwells roman

description.$: Indhold: John Rodden: Introduction. James Arnt Aune: Literary analysis of Animal farm. William E. Shanahan III: Basic tenets of marxism. Jonathan Rose: The russian revolution and Joseph Stalin. Denise Weeks: George Orwell and the road to Animal farm. John Rodden: Animal farm and the early cold war. John Rodden: The 1980s and 1990s: soviet glasnost, third world communism, and Orwell. William E. Shanahan III: Animal farm themes in light of late-twentieth-century public issues.

Indhold: The life (Orwell's painful childhood ; Orwell's Burma ; The ethics of responsibility: Burmese days ; Orwell: the honorary proletarian ; Orwell and the experience of France ; "an affirming flame": Homage to Catalonia ; Repeating the old lies) ; The art (Orwell's apocalypse: Coming up for air ; Orwell as film critic ; The reluctant propagandist ; The Wind in the Willows: a new source for Animal Farm ; Orwell's bestiary: the political allegory of Animal Farm ; The evolution of Nineteen Eighty-Four ; Nineteen Eighty-Four: a novel of the 1930s ; Miseries and splendors of scholarship ; The complete works of George Orwell ; Orwell: a voice that naked goes ; Orwell and the art of writing ; Orwell's satriric humor) ; Orwell after Orwell (Reviewing the Orwellians ; True to life: writing Orwell's biography)
